src:
Kejati Jabar Minta Identitas Oknum Jaksa Pemeras Aparat Desa Kabupaten Tasikmalaya Dibuka
07 Nov 2019, 11:35 by Yedi Supriadi
BANDUNG (PR).- Kejaksaan Tinggi Jawa Barat mempersilahkan para kepala desa untuk melaporkan oknum jaksa yang diduga melakukan pemerasan. Namun tentu saja laporan tersebut harus jelas identitasnya, waktu, dan kronologis kejadiannya, sehingga tidak jadi fitnah.
"Kalau oknum jaksa itu kan tidak jelas, ada ribuan jaksa. Tapi kalau nunjuk nama, siapa oknumnya, siapa yang diperasnya, itu baru dibisa diproses," kata Asisten Intelejen Kejati Jabar, Patris Yusrian Jaya didampingi Kasipenkum Kejati Jabar Abdul Muis Ali, Kamis 7 November 2019.
Pernyataan Patris tersebut menanggapi adanya aksi unjuk rasa ratusan aparat desa se-Kabupaten Tasikmalaya ke kantor kejari singaparna dan Gedung DPRD setempat soal adanya oknum jaksa yang memeras kades.
Patris memastikan bila laporan tersebut data awalnya ada, pastinya akan diproses. Namun kalau hanya dibilang oknum jaksa, susah untuk diposesnya. "Jaksa itu ada ratusan, bahkan ribuan, kalau tidak disebut nama ya susah untuk memprosesnya. Jadi yang kami butuhkan itu bukan bukti adanya oknum yang memeras, tapi data awal saja," ujarnya. 
Patris Yusrian Jaya menegaskan di kejaksaan itu bukan hanya jaksa saja yang bekerja, tapi ada pegawai honorer, ada juga pegawai kejaksaan. Jadi kalau memakai baju jaksa atau berkantor kejaksaan belum tentu jaksa, bisa saja oknum yang mengatasnamakan jaksa.
Bantah jaksa peras kades hingga meninggal
Memang diakui oleh Asintel bahwa ada kegiatan penegakan hukum oleh Kejari Kabupaten Tasikmalaya terhadap beberapa Kepala Desa yang diduga melakukan penyalahgunaan Keuangan Desa yang dananya bersumber dari APBN dan APBD baik dalam tahap Penyidikan maupun Penuntutan. 
"Kejari Singaparna memang sekarang lagi melakukan penegakan hukum atas dugaan korupsi dana desa," kata Patris.
Patris juga membantah informasi adanya jaksa yang melakukan intimidasi terhadap kades di Tasikmalaya hingga meninggal dunia.
"Apabila isu mengenai adanya kades yang meninggal karena intimidasi jaksa ini hanya merupakan berita bohong yang diembuskan oleh pihak yang merasa terancam dengan proses penegakan hukum yang dilakukan pihak kejaksaan, maka kami akan melakukan penelusuran dan proses hukum terhadap pihak tersebut," ucapnya.
Patris mengatakan pihaknya sudah menerjunkan tim saat adanya informasi soal kades meninggal diintimidasi jaksa. Berdasarkan hasil penyelidikan, tidak ditemukan adanya informasi tersebut. 
"Kalau ada orang yang diperiksa karena kasus korupsi, kemudian takut dan sakit lalu meninggal dunia, itu bukan meninggal karena intimidasi. Jadi tolong dipisahkan jangan malah dihembuskan jadi isu miring," ujarnya.
Apabila memang isu tersebut benar dan akibat diintimidasi oleh jaksa, Kejati tak segan akan memproses oknum jaksa tersebut. 
Di tempat terpisah Kasipenkum Abdul Muis menambahkan tim sudah diterjunkan mengenai adanya kabar kades meninggal gara gara diperiksa jaksa, tapi ternyata setelah dicek tidak ada. "Itu tidak ada kades meninggal gara-gara diperiksa jaksa," ujarnya. 
Menurut Abdul Muis, bila memang ada oknum jaksa yang melakukan penyalahgunaan maka akan ditindak sesuai dengan kesalahannya.*** 

Baca Juga
text:
West Java Prosecutor Asks The Identity Of Personnel Prosecutors To Open The Village Officials Tasikmalaya Regency
Nov 7 2019, 11:35 by Yedi Supriadi
BANDUNG (PR) .- The West Java Prosecutors Office invited village heads to report prosecutors suspected of extortion. But of course the report must be clear about its identity, time, and chronology of the incident, so that it does not become slander.
"If the person of the prosecutor is not clear, there are thousands of prosecutors. But if he names, who is the person, who is blackmailed, it can only be processed," said West Java Attorney Intelligence Assistant, Patris Yusrian Jaya accompanied by the Head of the North Sumatra Kasipenkum Abdul Muis Ali, Thursday 7 November 2019.
Patris's statement responded to the demonstration by hundreds of village officials from Tasikmalaya Regency to the Singapore office and the local DPRD building about the existence of a prosecutor who blackmailed the village head.
Patris ensures that if the report initially has data, it will certainly be processed. However, if it is only said to be a prosecutor, it is difficult to process it. "There are hundreds, even thousands of prosecutors, if it is not called by name it is difficult to process it. So what we need is not evidence that there are extortionists, but only the initial data," he said.
Patris Yusrian Jaya asserted that the prosecutor was not only the prosecutor who worked, but there were honorary employees, there were also prosecutors' employees. So if you wear a prosecutor's clothes or prosecutor's office is not necessarily a prosecutor, it could be someone who is on behalf of the prosecutor.
Denied the prosecutor squeezed the village head to death
It is recognized by Asintel that there is a law enforcement activity by the Tasikmalaya District Prosecutor's Office against a number of Village Heads who are suspected of misusing Village Finances whose funds are sourced from the State Budget and Regional Budget both in the Investigation and Prosecution stages.
"Kejari Singaparna is indeed now carrying out law enforcement for alleged corruption in village funds," said Patris.
Patris also denied the information that a prosecutor had intimidated the village head in Tasikmalaya until he died.
"If the issue of the village head who died due to intimidation by the prosecutor is only a hoax that has been released by those who feel threatened by the law enforcement process carried out by the prosecutor's office, we will conduct a search and legal process against that party," he said.
Patris said that his team had deployed the team when information about the village head was intimidated by the prosecutor. Based on the results of the investigation, no information was found.
"If someone is questioned for a corruption case, then afraid and sick and dies, it will not die because of intimidation. So please don't separate it instead, it will be blown up to become a slanted issue," he said.
If indeed the issue is true and the consequences are intimidated by the prosecutor, the Attorney General does not hesitate to process the individual prosecutor.
In a separate place Kasipenkum Abdul Muis added that the team had been sent about the news that the village head had died because of the prosecutor's examination, but apparently after checking none. "There was no village head died because of the prosecutor's examination," he said.
According to Abdul Muis, if there are indeed individual prosecutors who commit abuses, they will be prosecuted according to their mistakes. ***
